basics.name: Benjamin Russ
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineer and Robotics Researcher passionate about building responsive, force-aware robotic platforms. From academic research on multi-robot emergent behavior to industrial systems engineering at Honeywell, I integrate mechanical design with low-level control systems to enable adaptive, real-world robot performance. My experience in hardware, embedded control, and simulation allows me to develop and validate robust robotic testbeds that shorten iteration cycles

work.name: Honeywell Intelligrated
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

awards.title: Graduate Research Fellow
awards.awarder: Space Research Institute for Discovery and Exploration
awards.summary: This fellowship provided me the opportunity to finish my bachelors program and solely focus on my Master's work. I was able to reach great depth and complete many of the desired outcomes such as a full simulation and fully built prototype force sensitive robot.

projects.name: Custom Force-Feedback Motor Driver
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
